clinical_study.brief_title: Different Stimuli Were Given to Patients With Chronic Pure Tone Tinnitus to Verify the Effective Treatment of Tinnitus.
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Sound Stimulation, Somatosensory Stimulation, Vestibular Stimulation and the Combinations on Tinnitus Loudness and Tinnitus Related Distress in Patients
clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: In this experiment, patients with chronic pure tone tinnitus were divided into three groups to receive auditory stimulation, somatosensory stimulation, vestibular stimulation and combined stimulation, in order to find an effective way to treat tinnitus

detailed_description.textblock: 120 patients with chronic pure tone tinnitus over 6 months were randomly divided into 6 groups, one group was given auditory stimulation, one group was given somatosensory stimulation, one group was given auditory stimulation + somatosensory stimulation, one group was given auditory stimulation + vestibular stimulation, the last group was given auditory stimulation + somatosensory stimulation + vestibular stimulation.

Three months from the time the patient was selected to the end of the stimulus
primary_outcome.description: Detection of tinnitus frequency and loudness in patients

primary_outcome.time_frame: Three months from the time the patient was selected to the end of the stimulus
primary_outcome.description: Tinnitus handicap inventory score was used to detect the degree of tinnitus.0-16 points without disability, 18-36 points with mild disability, 38-56 points with moderate disability and 58-100 points with severe disability. The 95% confidence interval is 20 points, that is, the difference between the two tests before and after the experiment is greater than or equal to 20 points.

arm_group.description: Pink noise in both ears is given to tinnitus patients. The pink noise is removed by notch filter from tinnitus frequencies that are 20 decibel higher than the threshold.
Three stimulation points were selected for each ear of tinnitus patients, namely ear door (CN.V), auditory Palace (CN.VII) and Yifeng (C2/3). The stimulation intensity should be needle-sensed.
The patient sat on a rotating chair with sinusoidal harmonic acceleration and rotated without causing the greatest frequency of discomfort.
Combination of auditory and somatic stimulation for tinnitus patients
Combination of auditory and vestibular stimulation for tinnitus patients
Combination of auditory stimulation, somatic stimulation and vestibular stimulation for tinnitus patients

intervention.description: The patients were recruited to record their medical history, and the hearing level, tinnitus indicators, vestibular function and tinnitus disability indicators were tested. Then the patients were randomly divided into six groups. They received the corresponding stimulation 20 minutes a day, 5 days a week for 3 weeks. After the last stimulation, the above tests were repeated immediately, one week later and three months later.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pure tone tinnitus
- Unilateral and bilateral
- female and male
- Tinnitus has a history of more than 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pulsatile tinnitus of blood vessel
- Meniere's disease
- Chronic headache
- Neurological diseases (such as brain tumors)
- Patients with mental / mental illness undergoing treatment
- Pregnant women and patients with other untreatable diseases
